alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 7:52PM CDT until October 29 at 1:49AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 73.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 84.0 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 72.8 feet late this evening. It will then rise to 73.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall to 73.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 75.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
